title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 04 September 2014 - XWiki
content:
<vmassol> has quit  
03:50 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
04:06 <Denis> has quit  
06:13 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
06:43 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
06:45 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:04 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:19 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
07:57 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
08:04 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
08:06 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
08:07 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
08:24 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
08:51 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
08:52 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:53 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:04 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
09:18 <mflorea> has quit  
09:26 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
09:27 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:42 <tmortagne> vmassol: Hi  
09:42 <tmortagne> vmassol: xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards is supposed to failed like that, right ?  
09:42 <tmortagne> s/failed/fail/  
09:43 <tmortagne> I guess most of http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/lastBuild/testReport/ failing tests are cause by skin change  
09:44 <tmortagne> (most of them are about "Unable to locate the element")  
09:45 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:52 <tmortagne> hmm NullPointerException in wikimodel during WYSIWYG test  
09:52 <tmortagne> do we have recent WYSIWYG test ?  
09:52 <tmortagne> wikimodel code is really old now  
09:58 <vmassol> tmortagne: good monring  
09:58 <vmassol> well a part of it is indeed"supposed" to fail  
09:58 <vmassol> the html validation part  
09:59 <vmassol> we need to check if the WCAG tests can pass or not  
09:59 <vmassol> or maybe some can pass  
09:59 <vmassol> we need to upgrade the validation to use an htlml5 validator  
10:00 <vmassol> I haven(t researched it since GF was on it but maybe we could help him on that  
10:01 <tmortagne> we can concentrate on other things failing while waiting for Guillaume  
10:01 <tmortagne> it's mostly about http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/lastBuild/testReport/  
10:01 <tmortagne> I guess most of the ClassEditorTest.\* are the same thing  
10:02 <tmortagne> looking at ClassEditorTest  
10:02 <woshilapin> has quit  
10:02 <vmassol> there's a jira issue for the wysiwyg tests faiure  
10:03 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:03 <tmortagne> yes I remember Guillaume creating one  
10:03 <gdelhumeau> Hello  
10:03 <tmortagne> hi gdelhumeau  
10:03 <gdelhumeau> speaking of me? ;)  
10:03 <tmortagne> what is the current status around xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards ?  
10:03 <tmortagne> what is left do do basically ?  
10:03 <vmassol> it's edy actually  
10:03 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10838  
10:04 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
10:05 <gdelhumeau> we should desactivate the XHTML validator  
10:05 <tmortagne> is it all about XE-1415 ?  
10:05 <gdelhumeau> and in 6.3.x, replace it by the HTML5 validator  
10:05 <tmortagne> or there is more ?  
10:05 <gdelhumeau> AFAIK, it's that  
10:06 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: btw why wait in 6.3? is it that complex to use a hmlt5 validator?  
10:06 <gdelhumeau> and then fix the HTML5 violations  
10:06 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: because we won't have the time to fi xhtml5 violations before 6.2 final  
10:06 <vmassol> w3c seems to support an experimental html5 validator  
10:07 <vmassol> why not?  
10:07 <vmassol> how many violations are there?  
10:07 <vmassol> what do they imply?  
10:07 <vmassol> did you run xwiki's code throuh http://validator.w3.org/#validate\_by\_uri+with\_options ?  
10:07 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: there is 1,710 failures right now so changing the validator is not going to make it worst :)  
10:08 <gdelhumeau> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10840  
10:08 <gdelhumeau> and maybe change the htmlcleaner too: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7552?focusedCommentId=81336&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-81336  
10:10 <vmassol> there's also http://validator.nu/ and http://about.validator.nu/htmlparser/  
10:11 <vmassol> I'm on HC 2.9  
10:12 <vmassol> actually I already upgraded to 2.9 :)  
10:12 <vmassol> (I did it for the better html5 support)  
10:13 <vmassol> in response to your link: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7552?focusedCommentId=81338&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-81338  
10:13 <vmassol> ah you replied below  
10:13 <vmassol> need to check with the new version  
10:15 <vmassol> and I agree with marius this is what we've always done  
10:19 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: btw why cannot we use XHTML4?  
10:19 <vmassol> XHTML5 I mean  
10:20 <gdelhumeau> if there is an error, the browser does not display anything  
10:20 <vmassol> do you know why?  
10:20 <gdelhumeau> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7552?focusedCommentId=81333&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-81333  
10:20 <vmassol> xhtml1 doesn't seem to have this behaviore  
10:20 <vmassol> \*beavior  
10:21 <vmassol> hmmm  
10:22 <vmassol> the fact that were generating valid XHTML was a feature for xwiki  
10:22 <vmassol> s/were/we were  
10:26 <vmassol> btw gdelhumeau on http://stackoverflow.com/a/1415426 they say that HTML5 is not SGML  
10:29 <vmassol> indeed verified here: http://www.w3.org/TR/html5/single-page.html#conformance-requirements  
10:33 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: btw did we officially decide to use HTML5?  
10:33 <vmassol> I just want to be sure everyone has thought about it and agree. Personally I know I didn't give it enough thoughts (which is what I'm trying to do now by researching it a bit)  
10:34 <vmassol> (as quickly as I can)  
10:34 <vmassol> from what I see we don't have much choice since bootstrap generates HTML5  
10:34 <vmassol> well  
10:34 <gdelhumeau> http://markmail.org/message/4yhdlcxswbqdg3wv  
10:34 <vmassol> bootstrap doesn't generate html right?  
10:35 <gdelhumeau> you mean HTML code in generate or old HTML ?  
10:36 <gdelhumeau> you mean HTML code or old HTML ?  
10:36 <vmassol> thanks for the link, I missed it from the issue  
10:44 <vmassol> ok stopping my research now. I understand better the situation  
10:44 <vmassol> s/research/reading  
10:44 <woshilapin> has quit  
10:45 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
10:56 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
11:10 <vmassol> is anyone working on fixing the failing AWM tests at http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/lastBuild/testReport/ ?  
11:24 <plaugg> has joined #xwiki  
11:24 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:27 <Lyes1> has joined #xwiki  
11:54 <gdelhumeau> andreeapopescu: Hi  
11:54 <gdelhumeau> andreeapopescu: Do you have some time to test XE under IE8?  
11:56 <gdelhumeau> andreeapopescu: some time the window stay white, but maybe it comes from my instance through RDP with a poor connexion  
11:57 <tmortagne> vmassol: as I said before I'm looking at ClassEditorTest.\* failing tests  
12:00 <gdelhumeau> andreeapopescu: I'm reading your e-mail from yesterday, so it seems you already did  
12:02 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: in latest snapshot when I click on More app on the right I get http://postimg.org/image/ryrxdclft/  
12:03 <tmortagne> on teh left sorry  
12:03 <gdelhumeau> yes I'm gonna fix it  
12:03 <tmortagne> ok  
12:03 <tmortagne> is there a related issue ?  
12:03 <gdelhumeau> no it's recent  
12:04 <gdelhumeau> it has been introduced 2 days ago I think  
12:04 <tmortagne> the issue that caused it then  
12:04 <gdelhumeau> must be  
12:04 <gdelhumeau> XWIKI-10916  
12:05 <vmassol> I can also fix it gdelhumeau  
12:05 <vmassol> since I caused it, it should be easy for me to fix it  
12:06 <gdelhumeau> I'm working on it now  
12:06 <vmassol> ok  
12:06 <gdelhumeau> it's a one-line change  
12:06 <vmassol> after that it would be good if you could work on fixing the wysiwyg tests :)  
12:06 <gdelhumeau> there is 2 choices  
12:07 <gdelhumeau> 1/ workaround: we change the height of the headings in flamingo ( :( )  
12:07 <gdelhumeau> 2/ we fix the wysywg editor itself  
12:07 <gdelhumeau> I have tried to do 2/ but it's not easy  
12:10 <vmassol> mflorea: we need your opinion on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10838 , could you spare 5 minutes to read it?  
12:11 <vmassol> mflorea: and if you agree about keeping the default bootstrap value, could you give a hint to gdelhumeau to change the wysiwyg code?  
12:12 <gdelhumeau> my first idea was to change BoldExecutable  
12:12 <gdelhumeau> return iFontWeight > 400;  
12:13 <andreeapopescu> gdelhumeau: I was in my lunch break  
12:13 <gdelhumeau> andreeapopescu: no pb :)  
12:13 <andreeapopescu> gdelhumeau: I can make more tests on IE8, if it needed be  
12:13 <gdelhumeau> you did not see some strange behaviours ?  
12:13 <gdelhumeau> like needing to click several times to a link to open it?  
12:14 <andreeapopescu> gdelhumeau: not really, because I didn’t tests too much. I tested just some Fixed for, not a smoke tests or smth  
12:14 <andreeapopescu> gdelhumeau: so, I can start to make now some tests on ie8. wdyt?  
12:15 <gdelhumeau> that would be great :)  
12:15 <andreeapopescu> gdelhumeau: ok.. I’m starting :)  
12:15 <gdelhumeau> thanks!  
12:16 <andreeapopescu> you’re welcome  
12:17 <tmortagne> ok so it looks like it's impossible to click on AWM class editor buttons  
12:17 <tmortagne> that's what create most failing tests I guess  
12:18 <tmortagne> I can see the buttons but they are not link anymore  
12:31 <msmeria> vmassol: hello  
12:31 <msmeria> on the latest snapshot the "more apps" submenu items from the Applications panel aren't properly displayed & the links aren't working  
12:32 <msmeria> http://s8.postimg.org/uupx27jo5/more\_apps.png  
12:32 <vmassol> msmeria: fixed  
12:32 <vmassol> by gdelhumeau a few minutes ago  
12:32 <msmeria> vmassol: ok. good to know :)  
12:33 <vmassol> thanks for reporting ;)  
12:33 <msmeria> np  
12:37 <andreeapopescu> gdelhumeau: btw, do you want to test any particular testing scenarios?  
12:38 <gdelhumeau> andreeapopescu: no, it is just a gloabel feeling that I had  
12:38 <gdelhumeau> \*global  
12:39 <andreeapopescu> gdelhumeau: ok, great  
12:43 <mflorea> vmassol: I commented on the issue  
12:43 <vmassol> thanks  
12:49 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: but when the WYSIWYG sets <span style="font-weight: normal;">, it has visually no impact  
12:50 <gdelhumeau> and if I click again to "bold", it adds the <strong> tag that makes the headings even more bold  
12:51 <gdelhumeau> my idea was to change the limit of what is considered bold, an other value than 400  
12:51 <gdelhumeau> wdyt?  
12:56 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: I don't see any difference between a heading with 400 and one with 500 but that is just how FF decides to render the CSS. There's nothing wrong with the editor.  
12:57 <gdelhumeau> I don't understand  
12:58 <gdelhumeau> http://tof.canardpc.com/view/91323d2b-e540-45d4-9a14-3b85e5a81ad7.jpg  
12:58 <gdelhumeau> this is what I get when I click twice on "bold" on the editor  
12:59 <mflorea> http://imgur.com/5lZjtxQ  
12:59 <gdelhumeau> ah ok  
12:59 <gdelhumeau> But caty posted this: http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/attachment/28503/weight\_400.png  
12:59 <gdelhumeau> http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/attachment/28504/weight\_500.png  
13:00 <mflorea> I don't know how she made that, but for my FF there's no diff between 400 and 500  
13:00 <gdelhumeau> maybe it was chrome  
13:00 <gdelhumeau> I think she uses chrome  
13:00 <gdelhumeau> http://tof.canardpc.com/view/91323d2b-e540-45d4-9a14-3b85e5a81ad7.jpg is right ?  
13:01 <mflorea> same with Chrome  
13:01 <mflorea> yes!  
13:01 <gdelhumeau> by clicking twice?  
13:01 <mflorea> yes. as written in my comment on Jira  
13:02 <mflorea> Do you see a diff on headings from 400 to 500  
13:02 <gdelhumeau> do you think it is the result expected by the user?  
13:02 <mflorea> ?  
13:02 <gdelhumeau> on your screenshot, I don't see, indeed  
13:03 <mflorea> did you test locally?  
13:03 <mflorea> do you see any diff on your computer?  
13:04 <mflorea> I don't see any diff neither on FF not on Chrome, so I really don't see why flamingo is using 500  
13:04 <gdelhumeau> testing locally... I have the same result as you  
13:05 <gdelhumeau> so how Caty did produce her images?  
13:08 <mflorea> http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-fonts/#font-weight-prop  
13:08 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: I'm confused. When I set @headings-font-weight:    400; I don't see visual effect, but it fix the problem on the editor  
13:08 <mflorea> "Quite often there are only a few weights available for a particular font    family. When a weight is specified for which no face exists, a face with a    nearby weight is used"  
13:08 <mflorea> the font used needs to support multiple levels of bold!  
13:08 <gdelhumeau> maybe it's because you and I are not using mac-os  
13:08 <mflorea> yes, the font is OS dependent  
13:09 <gdelhumeau> OK so it could be an "issue" for mac users only then  
13:09 <mflorea> in this case really don't think it's a good idea to use font-weight 500  
13:09 <gdelhumeau> seems right  
13:09 <gdelhumeau> I will comment on the JIRA then  
13:10 <mflorea> Caty said that the reason is for hight contrast, but no everyone will get it!  
13:10 <mflorea> only mac users, or users of an OS that has fonts that support multiple levels of font-weight  
13:10 <mflorea> the rest will see no differencet  
13:11 <gdelhumeau> yes, but, by the other hand, it is good to level down the constrat for every body just because on linux we don't have it...  
13:11 <gdelhumeau> it is \*not\* good  
13:12 <mflorea> it should look good on linux too  
13:12 <mflorea> we don't support only mac  
13:13 <mflorea> linux users needs to distinguish headings also  
13:13 <Denis> has quit  
13:13 <gdelhumeau> good  
13:14 <gdelhumeau> we need to distinguish headings by an  other, os-independant, way  
13:14 <gdelhumeau> sounds good to me  
13:19 <gdelhumeau> Thanks mflorea  
13:22 <msmeria> vmassol: hello again  
13:22 <msmeria> I see you're the lead for http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XASELENIUM  
13:23 <msmeria> should I spend time working on these issues: http://jira.xwiki.org/issues/?jql=project%20%3D%20XASELENIUM ?  
13:24 <msmeria> I'm asking because I don't know if there are any users of both this application or Selenium IDE  
13:24 <vmassol> this project has been dead for a long time now but if you find it interesting and you have some needs for it, sure  
13:24 <vmassol> no users  
13:24 <vmassol> AFAIK  
13:24 <msmeria> I don't have any need for it :)  
13:25 <msmeria> should I close those issues or just unassign myself ?  
13:25 <vmassol> then you should probably not waste your time on it  
13:25 <vmassol> I wondered why you opened these issues when you created them but they're true so I didn't comment ;)  
13:25 <vmassol> unassign yourself  
13:25 <vmassol> they're still true  
13:25 <msmeria> Andreea reported them  
13:25 <vmassol> yes  
13:26 <vmassol> (I mixed up)  
13:38 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: FYI, I have reported the issue to BS: https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues/14529  
13:38 <mflorea> ok  
13:51 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
13:52 <bouquetf\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:11 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
14:12 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
14:26 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
14:34 <plaugg> has quit  
14:41 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:44 <vmassol> guys, do we support IE8 with Flamingin the end? gdelhumeau?  
14:45 <vmassol> \*flamingo  
14:45 <vmassol> AFAIK we added some compatibility layer to make it work in IE8  
14:45 <vmassol> but andreeapopescu reported lots of bugs today for IE8 and flamingo  
14:45 <vmassol> we need to decide if we want to fix them or not  
14:47 <sdumitriu> vmassol: About the forced skin action, it is indeed not needed, and possibly harmful  
14:47 <sdumitriu> Except for scriptaculous, I'm not sure but I remember that there's a bug like this:  
14:47 <sdumitriu> 1. Some pull them with forceSkinAction  
14:47 <sdumitriu> 2. Some don't  
14:48 <sdumitriu> 3. Any part of scriptaculous pulls in the others  
14:48 <vmassol> sdumitriu: the difference is I was is with the header caching  
14:48 <sdumitriu> 4. We get scriptaculous twice, once as a file resource and once as a /skin/ resource  
14:48 <vmassol> with the skin action, we set: response.setDateHeader("Expires", (new Date()).getTime() + 30 \* 24 \* 3600 \* 1000L);  
14:49 <vmassol> not sure what we get without the skin action though  
14:50 <vmassol> (ie cache for 30 days with skin action)  
14:50 <sdumitriu> 5. I think it might have been required in the past to pull the mains scriptaculous script with parsing enabled, so all the others had to be pulled in the same way  
14:50 <sdumitriu> But I don't think that's needed anymore  
14:50 <sdumitriu> And we should even deprecate all usage of scriptaculous  
14:51 <sdumitriu> It's been unmaintained since 2010  
14:51 <vmassol> ok, since we're late releasing RC1 I won't toucht his now but we can do some cleanup in 6.3  
14:51 <vmassol> I'll create a jira issue  
14:51 <sdumitriu> You can definitely fix images  
14:51 <sdumitriu> It doesn't affect overriding in any way, forceSkinAction is just for velocity parsing  
14:51 <sdumitriu> And that works only for js/css resources  
14:51 <vmassol> and caching  
14:51 <vmassol> and less now ;)  
14:52 <sdumitriu> Yes, caching, but I think the file resouce cache is even better  
14:52 <vmassol> ok  
14:52 <sdumitriu> And it lets the container apply extra speed improvements  
14:55 <vmassol> sdumitriu: actually I was amazed that xwiki works since we're pulling some js files with forceSkinAction  
14:55 <vmassol> and thus have velocity applied on them...  
14:56 <vmassol> we're just lucky I guess  
14:56 <vmassol> for ex in effects.js there are plenty of $A  
14:56 <vmassol> we're lucky that no var A is defined in the velocity context  
14:58 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
14:59 <vmassol> created XWIKI-10947  
14:59 <lucaa> sdumitriu: since i caught you here, could you please answer my comment on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10568 when you have a few minutes?  
15:01 <vmassol> IE8 market share is still 21% as of today so the answer is probably that we should....  
15:16 <tmortagne> ok Raluca created XWIKI-10943 so it seems to was on M2 already  
15:17 <tmortagne> that's what produce many AWM failing tests  
15:21 <vmassol> Inge-: FTR market shares: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/BrowserSupportStrategy  
15:22 <vmassol> btw going to edit this page since we agreed to support IE10/11 AFAIR  
15:23 <msmeria> has quit  
15:23 <vmassol> actually there's an ongoing discussion  
15:23 <vmassol> mflorea didn't fully agree  
15:23 <vmassol> mflorea was suggesting to drop support for IE8/9/10  
15:23 <vmassol> and only support IE11  
15:24 <vmassol> well he wasn't fully against it either  
15:24 <vmassol> not many other people responsed to this thread though  
15:24 <vmassol> tmortagne, gdelhumeau: could you reply please?  
15:24 <vmassol> http://xwiki.markmail.org/thread/ok27kxvdvh6xgx3y  
15:25 <vmassol> ATM IE8/9/10 represent 36.85%  
15:26 <vmassol> (compared to latest FF 31 which is 6.31%...)  
15:26 <vmassol> s/latest FF/FF/  
15:29 <Inge-> I expect this varies a LOT by country as well.  
15:30 <vmassol> http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Usage\_share\_of\_web\_browsers  
15:30 <vmassol> french is more updtaed it seems: http://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parts\_de\_march%C3%A9\_des\_navigateurs\_web  
15:30 <vmassol> indeed chrome goes to 40+% for europe/france  
15:31 <vmassol> and IE to 16%  
15:31 <tmortagne> yes it's very different depending on the regions  
15:31 <tmortagne> and even depending on the source...  
15:33 <vmassol> yep  
15:33 <vmassol> http://www.w3counter.com/globalstats.php  
15:34 <gdelhumeau> http://www.netmarketshare.com/browser-market-share.aspx?qprid=2&qpcustomd=0  
15:34 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: that's the one we're using ;)  
15:34 <vmassol> on http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/BrowserSupportStrategy  
15:41 <cjd> too bad we don't collect browsers in the xwiki stats collector  
15:42 <cjd> I've seen wildly different statistics on browser market share, somewhere it even says that IE is like 80% of the market and FF is 5%
